issues.fullMessage: Hardcoding an IP address into source code is a bad idea for several reasons: a recompile is required if the address changes; it forces the same address to be used in every environment (dev, sys, qa, prod); it places the responsibility of setting the value to use in production on the shoulders of the developer; it allows attackers to decompile the code and thereby discover a potentially sensitive address

properties.title: IP addresses should not be hardcoded
